author: Christopher Livingston
description: The eighth city builder in the Anno series has become its fastest seller, according to Ubisoft.
title: Despite 'Mixed' Steam reviews and a touch of AI slop, strategy city builder Anno 117: Pax Romana has the best launch in series history

author: Wes Fenlon
description: And it's all thanks to the MAME emulator.
title: Apple's 1991 Macintosh shipped with a bug that should've stopped it from booting, but no one ever knew because an undocumented CPU trick 'almost too crazy to be true' miraculously made it work

author: Andrea Shearon
description: Is 'pivot' code for 'join a clan'?
title: Rust's 'Pivot or Die' update was meant to shake up the meta, but it's a nightmare for solo survivors that leaves me no choice but to die

author: Lincoln Carpenter
description: Shoutout to the dozen Yian Garuga enthusiasts who just had their day made.
title: Monster Hunter is getting a Magic: The Gathering collab, and I think I speak for all fans of cool lizard art when I say: Hell yeah

author: Andy Chalk
description: Vedinad says they've previously released games under other studio names.
title: Megabonk developer withdraws from 'Best Debut Indie Game' nomination at The Game Awards for a pretty good reason: 'It's not my debut game'

author: Andy Chalk
description: Permadeath's sci-fi sandbox game was showcased as a Steam Daily Deal on November 12—the same day Valve announced the Steam Machine, Steam Frame, and Steam Controller.
title: Valve accidentally steps on the make-up deal it offered to the indie game whose 2024 release was ruined by a Steam bug: 'I really get the feeling that Planet Centauri is cursed'

author: Morgan Park
description: FOV 90: Project Misriah is a glimpse at the offbeat Source 2 shooters we should have by now, if not for Valve.
title: Counter-Strike 2 modders surprise drop an excellent Halo 3 multiplayer pack, accidentally proving how badly Valve has squandered Source 2

author: Tyler Colp
description: Prepare to try and read the whole thing in one sitting.
title: 20 hours of Elden Ring lore videos are being crammed into one big book by Souls YouTuber VaatiVidya

author: Lincoln Carpenter
description: Games are bigger than ever—but are they really better?
title: Fallout co-creator Tim Cain says today's games suffer from trying 'to be everything for everyone' when they should be learning from '80s games: 'These games were really focused, because they had to be'

author: Andy Chalk
description: It's a fair question.
title: Larian Studios responds to 2025 Game Awards nomination for Baldur's Gate 3, which came out more than 2 years ago: 'honestly, what the f**k'

author: Rich Stanton
description: "There was clearly a lot of excess investment, but none of us would question whether the internet was profound."
title: Everyone knows the AI business model is steal first, ask permission later, and Google's CEO is clinging to the notion of opt-outs as justifying it: 'We do give people those rights'

author: Rick Lane
description: Facepunch spied some suspiciously familiar C4 in Delta Force's most recent trailer.
title: Delta Force devs apologise after Facepunch Studios exec accuses them of stealing assets from Rust: 'If you wanted to collab, you should have reached out'

author: Rory Norris
description: Even scarier than the Queen.
title: How to find and kill a Matriarch in Arc Raiders

author: Joshua Wolens
description: I wrote elevators in the headline for the benefit of my American brothers, but from this point on it's strictly lifts.
title: Mass Effect 3 redeemed to glory as modder puts its ME1-style elevator back in

author: James Bentley
description: "Why do the models give these attackers what they want 90% of the time but the rest of us have to deal with asskissing, stonewalling and acid trips?"
title: Anthropic reports the first 80-90% 'AI-orchestrated' cyber espionage campaign, but cybersecurity critics are sceptical

author: Jess Kinghorn
description: Getting a lot of heat—literally.
title: A UK trial scheme is attempting to cut heating costs for households with shed-sized mini data centres

description: Get your PC purchases in ASAP, peeps.
title: PC and smartphone markets forecast to shrink in 2026 due to higher prices as memory supply crisis escalates and threatens to spoil Black Friday for PC fans

description: It's a great chance to convert your non-Battlefield 6 playing friends.
title: Battlefield 6 is putting on a week-long free trial to celebrate the latest seasonal content, which brings the warzone to an affluent Californian neighbourhood

author: Rick Lane
description: And that's how we ended up with Heaven's Vault.
title: The developer of 80 Days was once invited to pitch a Doctor Who game, but never heard back from the BBC afterward: 'Technically, we're still waiting for a reply'

description: It's nice to have options, isn't it?
title: Starting at $550, these two Alienware OLED ultrawide gaming monitor deals are making me hopeful for a bumper Black Friday

description: "I'm pretty good at videogames," said Musk.

description: Let there be light!

description: And now Microsoft owns both of them.
title: Former Activision CEO Bobby Kotick wanted to buy Minecraft until he found out Notch was leaving and Microsoft was offering a billion dollars more: 'I'll go airplane shopping with you, but you've gotta take that offer'

author: Jacob Fox
description: And that's a sentence I'm glad I can now utter.

description: Looks like we're going with Hero 45.

description: But there might be life in Desmond Miles yet.

description: The Prosecutor General's Office accuses GSC of "promoting Ukrainian narratives."
title: Russia just added Stalker dev GSC to its no-no list of 'undesirable organisations', sobs that Stalker 2 promoted 'Ukrainian narratives' and 'aggressive Russophobic content'

description: I'm not sure about that one, chief—or at least I can be, for $9.99 a month.

description: This is just weeks after the AWS outage.

description: "No one company should own a technology as powerful as AI"
